item.title: Docker 2
item.description: Docker-compose ~ container_name For my SDV701 assessment 2 we have to build a tiered software. I’ve decided to use Flask for the presentation tier, Flask-restful for the logic tier, and mongodb (via pymongo) for the data tier. I’ve also decided to use docker and docker-compose since running a mongodb server in docker is as easy as pulling an image from docker-hub. Below is a snippet from the docker-compose.yml file, showing how easy it is.

item.title: Docker 1
item.description: Docker-compose In this blog we are going to explore a tool thats apart of the docker ecosystem; docker-compose. “Compose is a tool for defining and running multi-container Docker applications.” [source] There is an awesome example found on the getting started section, which shows the power of docker-compose. The example is shown below. app.py import time import redis from flask import Flask app = Flask(__name__) cache = redis.Redis(host='redis', port=6379) def get_hit_count(): retries = 5 while True: try: return cache.
